reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowship scheme 2014/15

description.narrative: Grants to support international researchers to establish and develop collaborative partnerships with UK researchers.

The primary aims of the Newton Advanced Fellowship programme are to: • Support the development of a well - trained research community who can contribute to advancing economic development and social welfare of the partner country by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge. • Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early to mid-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. • Establish long-term links between the best research groups and networks in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. •8 fellowships ((Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships) between £74K and £100K over 2 years.

title.narrative: Newton International Fellowship scheme 2015/16 Round 1

description.narrative: Grants to support international researchers to spend two years in some of the UK’s best universities.

The primary aims of the Newton International Fellowship programme are to: • Support the development of a well-trained research community by supporting reserachers at an early stage of their career by providing an opportunity to work at a UK research institution for two years. • Establish links between researchers in partner countries and the UK to contribute to developing research and innovation capacity • 8 fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships) between £74K and £100K over 2 years.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowship scheme 2017/18 round

description.narrative: Grants to support international researchers to establish and develop collaborative partnerships with UK researchers.

The primary aims of the Newton Advanced Fellowship programme are to: • Support the development of a well - trained research community who can contribute to advancing economic development and social welfare of the partner country by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge. • Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early to mid-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. • Establish long-term links between the best research groups and networks in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. •10 fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships) between £100Kand £111K over 2-3 years.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships 2019/20 Round 2

description.narrative: Grants to support international researchers to establish and develop collaborative partnerships with UK researchers.

The primary aims of the Newton Advanced Fellowship programme are to: • Support the development of a well - trained research community who can contribute to advancing economic development and social welfare of the partner country by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge. • Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early to mid-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. • Establish long-term links between the best research groups and networks in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. •10 fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships) between £100Kand £111K over 2-3 years.

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships 2019/20

description.narrative: Grants to support international researchers to spend two years in some of the UK’s best universities.

The primary aims of the Newton Advanced Fellowship programme are to: • Support the development of a well - trained research community who can contribute to advancing economic development and social welfare of the partner country by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge. • Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early to mid-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. • Establish long-term links between the best research groups and networks in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. •10 fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships) between £100Kand £111K over 2-3 years.
